answers.answer: They really should seriously look to rule out any medical causes.Your description does sound like it MIGHT be anxiety related.  You could get tingly feeling from not breathing right in your hands when anxious.  Your estrogen dips to it's lowest point for your period, so that might explain the night sweats.  Sweating out in public might have to do with anxiety, especially if your heart is racing at the time.I had diarrhea daily for a long time a number of years ago and when I was prescribed librium 10 mg four times a day, the diarrhea stopped.  But, I had an endoscopy and colonoscopy and tried to figure out if anything medical was causing my symptoms first.
you should rule out celiac disease (gluten allergy) as well.

HiWelcome to the forum!What you have is chronic diarrhea since you have had it for last 6 months. Chronic diarrhea can be due to parasitic infestations (giardia, round worm, amoebiasis), irritable bowel syndrome, celiac disease, Crohn’s disease, malabsorption syndromes, pancreatic diseases, diabetes, hyperthyroidism etc.Maybe you can do a stool test to rule out parasitic cause. HIV too should be looked into and so also lactose intolerance. Lactose intolerance you can check yourself by stopping all dairy products.For others you would need some tests.Hope this helps. Please let me know if there is any thing else and do keep me posted. Take care!
